info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 01 at 7:29PM EDT until May 01 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN NEWBERRY...NORTHWESTERN LEXINGTON...EAST CENTRAL SALUDA AND NORTHWESTERN RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 727 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, Irmo, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Oak Grove, St. Andrews, Dreher Island State Park, Ballentine, Chapin, Cedar Grove Fire Station, South Shore Marina, Oswald Park, Bundrick Island, Putnam`s Landing, White Rock, Rocky Point Recreation Area, Hollow Creek Public Park, Melvin Park, Seven Oaks and Lighthouse Marina. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 59 and 63. Interstate 26 between mile markers 91 and 105. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Murray move away from the water and take shelter!
